comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@konchirorin Hi. I don't have Line account, can't register.
Could you please test with `non-filtered DNS` + `DNS filter`?
If reproduced an issue:
- close the app
- open AdGuard => Recent Activity and clear it
- open the app and reproduce an issue
- go to Recent Activity, swipe down to refresh, select `Show blocked` and make a screenshot.

Resolved by List-KR filter.
The patch will be available in up to 4 hours.
After that time, you can download it by clicking `Check for filter updates...` via AdGuard menu in your browser toolbar.

<details>
<summary>한국어 - Korean</summary>

List-KR 필터에 의해 해결되었습니다.
패치는 최대 4시간안에 사용하실 수 있습니다.
최대 4시간이 지난 후에 브라우저 툴바에 있는 AdGuard 아이콘을 통해 `필터 업데이트 확인...`을 클릭하여 다운로드하실 수 있습니다.

</details>

comment.body:
> I found that the issue is due to the rule " ||piano.io^ " in Peter Lowe's Blocklist.
> Please tell me how to solve the issue without unblocking the rule

You can disable that rule by adding to user rules:
`||piano.io^$badfilter`

Do not close AdGuard window ~60 seconds, because iOS will breaks configuration process.

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/158808#issuecomment-1676249134 - It seems that it's caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`, so please disable it or add this rule:
```adblock
cnbc.com#@$#.icon-search::before { font-size: 20px !important; }
```
to user rules.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Desktop

_No response_

comment.body:
@Alex-302 
If you mean my internet service provider, the answer is: I don't know!
I connect the phone to several different networks, so I thought a good idea to enable DPI.
The blocking does not happen consistently on my side.
Sometimes, if I press "Reload" several times, it eventually loads.
Then I check the https certificate, and it is no longer Adguard's.
Adding @@||cleaneatingmag.com^$stealth=dpi to the user rules fixes it for me.
However, in my opinion this should be fixed on Adguard's side. As it may affect other users as well.
